text: hey there, can anyone explain the difference between OnFormReady and onFormSubmit. I have created an event listener in GA4, but it looks like it does not get triggered always when someone completes my embedded hbs form. any ideas if onformready should solve it'?

onFormReady means the form has rendered on the page, so probably not the right solution here. onFormSubmit means the submit button was pressed, but not necessarily that the form was accepted. You _probably_ want onFormSubmit*ed*: <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/global-form-events>

For anyone looking into this the reason is that you can only have a max of 2 unique properties on a custom object:
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Creating-property-on-custom-object-return-402-payment-required/m-p/606035#M52108>
